channel.title: Disney Monorail Crash
channel.description:
Article: http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090705/ap_on_re_us/us_disney_monorail_crash
LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. – Two monorail trains crashed early Sunday morning in the Magic Kingdom section of Walt Disney World, killing one train's operator, emergency officials said. Disney said it was the first fatal crash in the monorail's 38-year history in the park. The transit system, which shuttles thousands of visitors around the sprawling resort each day, was shut down while authorities investigated the holiday weekend wreck.
Not so safe after all eh. How the hell do they crash? I thought there was only one monorail per track >_<

item.title: Disney Monorail Crash
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

BloodRayne:

Do you know if the accident took place in one of the “station” things?

A witnesses’ description of the crash is below.

"A monorail was waiting to come into the station ... or it did not leave the station, and the other one cleared through the station, and there was a head-on collision," the male caller said.

From this article: http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hQkSBcJYEealqbWm6v_FoKe1gknAD9996ILG0

Read full topic

@cooper wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:1, topic:287309”]Not so safe after all eh.

How the hell do they crash? I thought there was only one monorail per track >_<[/quote]
It still is relatively safe, this was probably the train operators fault.
And no, there are several, just having one per track would be extremely slow.
